title: Eliza Dushku Missed Bring it On Reunion With Gabrielle Union , Kirsten Dunst
body_text:
Eliza Dushku's former costars are cheering her on in her new career.
After the Bring It On alum missed out on the movie’s 25-year reunion Sept. 21, where former castmates Kirsten Dunst, Gabrielle Union, Jesse Bradford and Lindsay Sloane were in attendance, Eliza explained why she skipped the anniversary celebration.
"Sorry to have missed the 25-year Bring It On reunion with you all!" she wrote on Instagram Stories Sept. 26, sharing throwback photos from the film. "I just started my official new counseling/behavioral therapist job last week and spent the weekend deep in glorious documentation + session prep."
Eliza—who posted in May that she had graduated with her Master of Arts in Clinical Mental Health Counseling—continued, "Sending all the love - so proud to have been part of this cultural phenomenon (and honestly, just the most super awesome and fun!) world of BIO with you ALL. xoxo, E aka 'Missy P.'"
But her costar Gabrielle didn’t mind at all, writing back in an Instagram Story of her own, "So proud of you."
“Always a badass!” the Being Mary Jane star added. “Congratulations on your new job!"
Centered around cheerleaders from Southern California, Bring It On was released on August 22, 2000. And for Gabrielle, playing the East Compton Clovers cheer captain was a total game changer.
"Back then, I never would’ve imagined stepping into the East Compton Clover uniform would bring so many blessings," the 52-year-old shared on Instagram Aug. 23. "It truly is the gift that keeps on giving."
Indeed, she shared that back in 2000, the cast never could have imagined the hit the film would become—with it even inspiring a Broadway musical 12 years later.
"We just thought we were having a fun summer in San Diego, making a movie about cheerleading," she reflected in the video, "but we made an instant classic about so much more—politically, socially relevant topics that are still resonating today."
And she noted she has the fans to thank for continuing the legacy.
"You guys have shown up since day one," she continued, "and you continue to show up again and again."
To see what the Bring It On cast has been up to since then, keep reading.
